fields.description:
*Assessment*

When {{AWS::EC2::VolumeAttachment}} is used in an Update Stack scenario, no error is displayed in stack events.  The stack fails to update, but there is not error stating that {{AWS::EC2::VolumeAttachment}} is not supported for UpdateStack.

comments.body:
[~ethomas],  I had to do a couple of things here:
# I couldn't use a cloud that had DAS for EBS backend support.  If I did, then I would see the behavior you mentioned above.  When I raised this bug, I used a VPC cloud with Ceph for Object and Block Storage.  
# I was able to reproduce the issue mentioned above (regarding no error message for {{AWS::EC2::VolumeAttachment}} resource), however it shows the {{WaitHandle}} error, THEN shows the {{VolumeAttachment}} resources update complete.  Whats interesting here, is that I can run the {{cfn-instance-test-update9.json}} in a CreateStack call, it creates a stack just fine.  However, when using it with UpdateStack, the WaitHandle error shows up.  Could this be another bug? *shrug*

Here is the full output showing the {{AWS::EC2::VolumeAttachment}} update complete with no error:
